humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, ignoring any substaging information. In this report, the largest tumor is found in the right breast, which measures approximately 6 cm. According to the rules provided, a tumor of this size would be classified as T3 (more than 5 cm). Therefore, the predicted T stage for this patient is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In the right breast, the tumor measures approximately 6 cm in greatest dimension (pT3). In the left breast, the tumor measures maximally 5 x 5 x 3 mm, which would correspond to a T1 stage. However, the T stage is based on the larger tumor, so the T stage for this patient is T3.
